summary.p: [1] Blarer has just received the following news from a good man who is zealous for God's cause:

[2] It is reported both orally and in writing by reputable and well-informed people that Emperor Charles V (should he remain alive until spring) will definitely punish the Swiss Confederates and attack from several places. Even now, secret machinations are underway to divide the Confederates.
[3] Blarer has not received Bullinger's letter with Kaspar Seidensticker's letter and the money still owed to him and Konrad Zwick.
[4] Bullinger should report what Konrad Zwick recently replied to him in conversation about the matter [of the war machine], which Blarer had already written about [in No. 3066].
[5] The innkeeper [Caspar Bodmer] of the [inn Zum Rotenhuß] is said to have a brother-in-law who knows a remedy for fever. Bullinger should inquire about it and share the recipe.

div.p: At this moment, among other things, I receive this news from a very pious, zealous man, with these words:

“I cannot withhold from you that it is spoken and written by reputable people, who are considered knowledgeable, that it should not be doubted, and one should prepare accordingly, that if His Imperial Majesty survives the spring, His Majesty will certainly undertake to punish the Swiss Confederates and attack them not in one or two, but in several places. And even now, the practice is being made that they themselves should be disunited and divided among each other.”
Know that your writings from Seidensticker and the money have been received. I express my diligent thanks to you.
Dear friend, let me know what my cousin recently replied to you regarding your conversation, about which I have written to you.
Also, the innkeeper at your place is said to have a brother-in-law who knows a very certain remedy for fever. I would like you to find out and write it down for me in due time.
God be with you and yours forever. Amen. Dated at one o'clock, the 23rd of November.
To Master Heinrich Bullinger in Zurich.
